document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tetrameres L.W.
Schaufuss, 1877a: 460
[synonymized by L.W.
Schaufuss 1877b: 24
]

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Tetratarsus plicatulus L.W. Schaufuss, 1877

Type species:
Tetratarsus plicatulus L.W. Schaufuss, 1877
107 species are included in this genus from Latin America.

Characters/Description:
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002: 257
(characters in key).

Key: Puthz 1973: 51 (Neotropical species); Puthz 2001c: 26 (Mexican species); Puthz 2006a: 84 (species of
ventralis
group); Puthz 2014: 814 (species of the New World).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , Suriname , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Chile .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Gravenhorst, J. L. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gravenhorst, J. L. C. (1806) Monographia Coleopterorum Micropterorum. H. Dieterich, Gottingae [Gottingen]. xvi + 248 pp., 1 pl.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Eristhetus Leach in
Samouelle, 1819: 174
[synonymized by
Lacordaire 1854: 109
]

subSubSection.paragraph: 15 species are included in this genus from the West Indies and Central America.

Characters/Description:
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002: 257
(characters in key).
Central America: Mexico , Nicaragua , Costa Rica .

bibRefCitation.author: Fauvel, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Fauvel, A. (1873 b) Faune Gallo-Rhenane ou description des insectes qui habitent la France, la Belgique, la Hollande, les provinces Rhenanes et le Valais, avec tableaux synoptiques et planches gravees. (Suite 1). Bulletin de la Societe Linneenne de Normandie, 2 (6), 8 - 136. [Note: nominal year of publication 1870 - 1872]

subSubSection.paragraph: 26 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Puthz 1977b: 108 (some Neotropical species); Puthz 2001a: 27 (Neotropical species).
Central America: Mexico , Belize , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Venezuela , Suriname , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil , Paraguay .
Other regions: Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

Type species:
Schatzmayrina oxyclypea C. Koch, 1934
1 species is included in this genus from South America.
Key: Puthz 2007: 85 (some species of the genus).

Type species:
Tamotus femoratus L.W. Schaufuss, 1874
10 species are known from and are restricted to Latin America.
Key: Puthz 1973: 62 (species of the genus); Puthz 2002: 123 (species of the genus).
South America: Suriname , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil , Paraguay .
